abstract.t: The DTNRG research group has defined many protocols such as Bundle Protocol and Licklider. The specifications of these protocols contain fields that are subject to a registry. For the purpose of its research work, the group created adhoc registries[DTNRGREG]. As the specifications are stable and have multiple interoperable implementations, the group would like to handoff the registries to IANA for official custidy. This document describes the actions needed to be executed by IANA.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: The DTNRG research group has defined many protocols such as Bundle Protocol and Licklider. The specifications of these protocols contain fields that are subject to a registry. For the purpose of its research work, the group created adhoc registries[DTNRGREG]. As the specifications are stable and have multiple interoperable implementations, the group would like to handoff the registries to IANA for official custidy. This document describes the actions needed to be executed by IANA.

section.title: Bundle Protocol
section.t: The Bundle Protocol(BP) has fields requiring a registry managed by IANA.

section.title: Bundle Block Types
section.t: The Bundle Protocol has a Bundle Block Type code field (section 4.5.2). An IANA registry shall be setup as follows.

The registration policy for this registry is:
0-191: Specification Required 192-255: Private or experimental use. No assignment by IANA.
The Value range is: unsigned 8 bit integer.
The value "0" was not defined in any document or in the adhoc registry. As per concensus by the DNTRG research group, it is reserved per this document.
RG TBD: decide for value 0. decide registration policy

section.title: Primary Bundle Protocol Version
section.t: The Bundle Protocol has a version field (section 4.5.1). An IANA registry shall be setup as follows.
The registration policy for this registry is: RFC Required
The Value range is: unsigned 8 bit integer.
RG TBD: decide registration policy. versions 0-5 are ...

section.title: Bundle Processing Control Flags
section.t: The Bundle Protocol has a Bundle Processing Control flags field (section 4.2). An IANA registry shall be setup as follows.
The registration policy for this registry is: Specification Required
The Value range is: Variable length.

texttable.c: Application data unit is an administrative record

section.t: RG TBD: decide registration policy.

section.title: Block Processing Control Flags
section.t: The Bundle Protocol has a Block Processing Control flags field (section 4.2). An IANA registry shall be setup as follows.
The registration policy for this registry is: Specification Required
The Value range is: Variable length.

texttable.c: Block must be replicated in every fragment
Transmit status report if block can't be processed
Delete bundle if block can't be processed
Discard block if it can't be processed
Block was forwarded without being processed

section.t: RG TBD: decide registration policy.

section.title: Bundle Status Report Flags
section.t: The Bundle Protocol has a Status Report Status Flag field(section 6.1.1). An IANA registry shall be setup as follows.
The registration policy for this registry is: Specification Required
The Value range is: 8 bits.

texttable.c: Reporting node accepted custody of bundle

section.t: RG TBD: decide registration policy. value 0 is ...

section.title: Bundle Status Report Reason Codes
section.t: The Bundle Protocol has a Bundle Status Report Reason Codes field(section 6.1.1). An IANA registry shall be setup as follows.
The registration policy for this registry is: Specification Required
The Value range is: unsigned 8 bit integer.

texttable.preamble: Bundle Status Report Reason Codes Registry
texttable.c: No known route to destination from here
No timely contact with next node on route

section.t: RG TBD: decide registration policy. do we want to reserve a value for future extensions? 255?

section.title: Bundle Custody Signal Reason Codes
section.t: The Bundle Protocol has a Bundle Custody Signal Reason Codes field(section 6.1.2). An IANA registry shall be setup as follows.
The registration policy for this registry is: Specification Required
The Value range is: unsigned 7 bit integer.

texttable.preamble: Bundle Custody Signal Reason Codes Registry
texttable.c: Redundant reception (reception by a node that is a custodial node for this bundle)
No known route to destination from here
No timely contact with next node on route

section.t: RG TBD: decide registration policy. do we want to reserve a value for future extensions? 255?

section.title: URI Scheme
section.t: IANA has registered the "dtn" URI Scheme [IANAURISCH:http://www.iana.org/assignments/uri-schemes.html] as provisional. This document requests to change the status of this assignment from "Provisional" to "Permanent".
RG TBD: request dtn as permanent? has to be "ready" per RFC4395

section.title: MIME Media Type
section.t: RG TBD: do we want application/dtn?

section.title: LickLider Protocol Version
section.t: The Licklider Protocol has a version field (section 3.1). An IANA registry shall be setup as follows.
The registration policy for this registry is: RFC Required
The Value range is: unsigned 4 bit integer.
RG TBD: decide registration policy.

section.title: LickLider Cancel Segments Reason Codes
section.t: The LickLider Protocol has Cancel Segments Reason Codes field(section 3.2.4). An IANA registry shall be setup as follows.
The registration policy for this registry is: Specification Required
The Value range is: unsigned 8 bit integer.

texttable.preamble: LickLider Cancel Segments Reason Codes Registry
texttable.c: Received either a red-part data segment at block offset above any green-part data segment offset or a green-part data segment at block offset below any red-part data segment offset
A system error condition caused unexpected session termination

section.t: RG TBD: decide registration policy. RFC5326 says 6-255 is "reserved". does that mean no new assignment, or "unassigned"?
